availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles B. Duncan (Hancock County, KY, dry good merchant and member of the Hancock County Home Guard)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, dry goods merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Julia Duncan. Married to Sallie Duncan. Father of Julia A. Duncan, Sarah M. Duncan, Willie Duncan, and Fannie Smith. Dry goods merchant in Hancock County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the Hancock County Home Guard as third lieutenant. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 115.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 3-4.
"Charles B. Duncan (1818-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial #144030902, accessed August 21, 2018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144030902.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-12.
KYR-0002-022-0048.
